page.title: 07THE NATIONAL PARK
page.content: There are ten National Parks in England and Wales.The Northumberland National Park was designated in 1956.The park provides information centres,wardens,picnic areas,toilets and,a more recent innovation,guided walks.People are welcome to walk across the whole area so long as they respect the farmland and follow the country code.Within this area are new woods planted by the Forestry Commision.Elsewhere,the Ministry of Defence own large parts of the area,allowing occasional access.There is an information centre at Ingram,which also serves as a Mountain Rescue Post.There used to be only one full-time warden and two part-time wardens in the area,now the valley is served by several full-time wardens one of whom lives in nearby Brandon.
